text: I joined several colleagues, including @NydiaVelazquez, in pressing the administration on their new policy limiting entry at the border. We need to ensure that unaccompanied minors, survivors of human trafficking and other vulnerable groups are given the refuge they deserve. https://t.co/90mRWv8bl5

If you are In a dangerous domestic situation, New York State will help you find safe shelter. You are not trapped just because of COVID-19. If you are in immediate harm, call 911. If you need help, call the State's Domestic Violence Hotline at 1-800-942-6906.
As of today, small business owners can file to receive a loan through the SBA's new Paycheck Protection Program.  Apply and learn more here: https://t.co/tTIzLRlmab

Free meals are now available to everyone in New York. The city has 435 sites where people can get breakfast, lunch and dinner all to go, free of charge. To find a location near text "NYC FOOD" to 877-877 or go to https://t.co/ZiHaBPpks6
If you're struggling to navigate the different city, state and federal benefits you may eligible for, the City has created a one stop shop: https://t.co/wrouS0AWd0 https://t.co/Shg7glxsBg
Unsure how to apply for unemployment benefits? Start here https://t.co/zGEpcom5zz https://t.co/MldBAwEO19
Every Friday, our office sends out a newsletter with information on COVID-19 and other important updates. Sign up here: https://t.co/8Jxx5b30GS
Si has perdido tu trabajo por la crisis del coronavirus, es probable que seas elegible para el nuevo programa de seguro de desempleo. https://t.co/jnW4K049lw

The federal definition of poverty leaves out many people in need. @GerryConnolly and I formally asked @OMBPress today to take more time to work with academics, advocates & state/local governments on this issue. To end poverty, we first need to measure it accurately. https://t.co/mWMqAkFmDQ
Earlier today, @RepMaloney and I sent a letter to @US_FDA to revise its policy of turning away blood donations from gay and bisexual men. You can check it out here 👇 https://t.co/78qSWG4FTp
Únete a tus vecinxs neoyorquinxs en estos momentos: Completa el #Censo2020. Miles de millones están en juego. Llena el censo hoy en https://t.co/k2CilCap6t #HazteContar

Many of us are spending more time with our families indoors to #flattenthecurve. Use this time to help your community get the resources it needs by completing the #2020Census online at https://t.co/k2CilCap6t.

NYC small businesses owners with 1-4 employees can apply for the City's Employee Retention Grant, if you've been hurt by COVID-19. The deadline is THIS Friday, April 3 https://t.co/66KWBgfx0r

Other resources for small business owners are available here: https://t.co/TRcKPAfMIN
The City is connecting older New Yorkers who are feeling isolated with friendly volunteers to talk with over the phone. Call 212-244-6469 to be connected with a volunteer today.

It's Census Day! The Census is just 10 questions and takes just 10 minutes to complete - but it determines our community’s funding and representation for the next 10 years. Fill out the census online, over the phone, or by mail.  Go to https://t.co/k2CilBSNHT #CensusDay

If you live in New York and can't afford to pay your rent due to COVID-19, you cannot be evicted. Learn more about the eviction moratorium and other economic relief for NY-14 constituents on our website: https://t.co/rToOTbHr5y

Rent is due tomorrow for millions, but nearly 1 in 5 households have already experienced a coronavirus layoff or reduction in work hours. If we had #equalpay, Latinas would have an "extra" $28,000 from last year to each fall back on right now. #EqualPayDay https://t.co/DnAbGJmwWS

The City is now offering delivery meals to seniors across all 5 boroughs. Grab and go meals will no longer be available at senior centers, starting tomorrow, for the health of seniors and staff. You can sign up for delivery by calling 212-AGING-NYC or 311.

RT @NYSLabor: We hear your concerns. We are doing everything we can to address the surge in volume and ensure all benefits are paid.

Pleas…

On Friday, Congress passed legislation to send $1200 to most U.S. adults in the coming weeks.  You can find information about that and other economic relief available to New Yorkers on our website: https://t.co/rToOTbHr5y

In Queens, 34th Ave from 73rd St to 80th St will be closed to vehicular traffic starting today from 10-7 through Monday, March 30th as part of the City’s pilot program to provide additional open space as a means to facilitating social distancing protocols.

Late yesterday, @RepGraceMeng and I wrote to President Trump urging him to send more PPE and ventilators to Elmhurst Hospital in Queens. 
The City reported that the hospital recently received 40 ventilators and 56 additional staff. https://t.co/GFnTZe08KU https://t.co/m9eaPCIe6S
If you have questions about COVID-19 or believe you may have mild symptoms, call your health care provider or 311.  @FDNY asks that you call 911 only for emergencies.

I recently went to LGA after learning ICE was flying 6 minors from Texas to New York, in the midst of the COVID-19 outbreak. I then wrote to ICE demanding to know what precautions they are taking to keep these children and everyone else in their custody safe. We deserve answers. https://t.co/DM6o91D3WY

.@RepGraceMeng and I spoke with health care providers in our districts yesterday. They need critical supplies, like personal protective gear. There's still a lot to come, and we are ready to work with the Army Corps of Engineers and National Guard to support our institutions.
For more information on COVID-19 and the Census go to https://t.co/ecAWCyeaVS.  And, don’t forget, now is the perfect time to fill out your Census form online: https://t.co/k2CilCap6t

We also answered questions about testing. Tests are now free but we don’t have enough. If you have mild symptoms, stay home and self-quarantine. Do not try to go to an ER and get a test. It will overwhelm our hospitals and healthcare providers who are already feeling the strain. https://t.co/DbsAsHWL7O

We are also asking the Census Bureau to extend the enumeration period by at least 3 months. I encourage everyone to self-report online now at https://t.co/k2CilCap6t. The Census will determine your community's funding and representation for the next decade. https://t.co/yQfBqk2PdO

We’re also fighting for college students. It’s time to cancel all student loan debt and reimburse low-income students who were forced to buy expensive last-minute tickets to get home after their campuses shut down. https://t.co/kUeETrsFdp

We are fighting for real economic relief for working families, including eviction freezes, paid sick leave, and no-strings emergency UBI. I also partnered with @RepChuyGarcia on measures that would stop foreclosures and protect credit ratings. https://t.co/sfvPokh6zS
We also shared how the Trump administration's cruel "public charge" rule puts us all at risk. Undocumented people must have access to medical care without fear of retribution. https://t.co/5fdrYsHHx1

We discussed why decarceral policies are a critical part of the response to COVID-19.  We must aggressively reduce our incarcerated population in order to avoid a potentially deadly outbreak across our city and state prisons. https://t.co/eQ5do6v8k3
We recently held our first virtual town hall, with presentations on the Census and COVID-19 from experts at @nycHealthy, @NYCSchools, and the US & NYC Census Bureau. Here are some of the highlights….

Our monthly town hall is underway. Join us for information on the Census and COVID-19. 

https://t.co/jRANOTeSOH

Our monthly town hall is today! We'll be doing it virtually to protect the health of our most vulnerable communities. There will be presentations and Q&A on the Census and COVID-19.  

You can sign up here: https://t.co/jRANOTeSOH

Census2020 starts today! You can now self-report online at https://t.co/k2CilCap6t

Your response is confidential. Everyone should participate, regardless of status. The Census determines your community's representation and fed funding for the next 10 years! Let's #GetCountedNYC

Quick detection is critical to fighting COVID-19. That's why I'm joining other leaders in New York and calling on the CDC to make sure NYC and communities across the country have the number of testing kits they need. Right now, we don't have enough.

President Trump is engaging in arms deals with Modi while his administration is ethnically cleansing the country’s religious minorities. We must not enable this rise in sectarian violence. https://t.co/WwUyf9cNCN

No importa de dónde eres, cuántos años tienes, o cuál es tu situación de vivienda - ¡tu comunidad depende de que te hagas contar en el #Censo2020!

Únete a @NYCMayor, @JulieMenin y a la iniciativa del NYC Census 2020: https://t.co/RhQtB3iPdC #GetCountedNYC https://t.co/jeKWdKzpgD

Over 800,000 #Dreamers have benefited from #DACA, but the Trump administration has left the future of the program unclear. If your status expires before 2020 you should renew now! #HomeIsHere https://t.co/e4fay4WKbM

No matter where you're from, how old you are, or what your living situation is, your community is relying on you to get counted in the #2020Census!
Join @NYCMayor, @JulieMenin and the NYC Census 2020 initiative at: https://t.co/RhQtB31em4 #GetCountedNYC https://t.co/OCjhi3elix

It’s a disgrace that the Trump Admin is treating migrants & asylum seekers like this -  1 year+ of #RemainInMexico has proven dangerous, and in some cases deadly. We must end this horrific policy. #DontLookAway
https://t.co/wq5Q1wY13f

Los trabajadoras/es del hogar son uno de los grupos más vulnerable – a veces sufriendo de abuso físico, mental y sexual o falta de días de descanso. Estoy tan emocionada de unirme con @YalitzaAparicio para luchar por los derechos laborales de nuestra/os trabajadora/os del hogar. https://t.co/CN7cq00iRg

The deadline to get health insurance on the exchange in New York is January 31st.

Get free enrollment assistance in your language by:
✅Calling 311
✅Texting CoveredNYC (SeguroNYC en Español) to 877877
✅Online at https://t.co/afrjbWRyEu
